alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Oxford; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 9:06PM EDT until September 13 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOMERSET, SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN AND EAST CENTRAL OXFORD COUNTIES... At 906 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Farmington, Jay, Dixfield, Kingfield, Canton, Wilton, Anson, Embden, Carthage and Avon. Rain rates have diminished, with only light rain expected to continue. Flooding may still result due to runoff from earlier rainfall. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
